xml.body:
@r263@
Edmond Schethers Answer unto.
2 & 3 I can not depose by the relation of Mr parkrst selleger & other
$1$ To the first I know not but by relation of whether Mr parkurst & Mr senllenger presented the
same articles or no or whether they be fewr or alterd. but by ther own relation.
$2$ I did not here the witnes published but I hard the witnes say that
thei wold depose in them if thei wer examened. I know not.
$3$ I say as to the first article. I know not.
$4$ I hard him my lordes grace Rebuke mr serles for that he hadd preached so much of ymages
and my lordes grace said that idolum & imago was one for the one was the grek woord
& the other the laten./ otherwise I know not that he did rebuk him.
& I hard not my lordes grace rebuke him for thos woordes.
$5.$ I hard his grace say in his chamber befor many prebendaris & prechers that
the kynges plesur was to have .3. prechers of the new lerning & iii
of the old but I hard not thes woordes spoken in the consistory.
$6$ I know not who accused them & therfor I can not depose of the article nor whether thei wer suspecte for ewell opynions
$7$ I did se .3. which cam voluntaryli to testifie for Mr serles which could not be
admitted as master serles said Also I required that the vicar of northgat & mr gardener master
sellenger coxston might be examened in my first article which wer
redy but by reson of delay the said vicar was wered & not examened
& whether the other wer examyned or no I can not tell.
$8$ In the deposition of my first article then obiected was admitted
george may & Sir humfrey cherdayn parsons suspecte for evell opynions by common fame as I herd
and certayn which deposed aganst mr serles wer likwise suspecte And befor
sentens I desired my lordes grace to have respect to the parsons that did depose.
$9$ I thinke them innocent prechers And I did redde a declaration of articles
which wer surmised aganst me : but by whome serles was committed to
prison I can not tell
$10$ By reison that I and serles wer willed to redde declarations in the
which it was mentioned that that which we said was seditiously
spoken I thinke the occasion of our my accasation did rise <>
that I somtymes spak aganst evell opynions by the which wherfor <>
have spoken the lesse aganst the same bicause I wold <>
like occasion. & further I can not say in the article.
$11$ Sir bland mr scory sir turner have be noted much bolder syn<>
of the said accusation vpon what occasion ells I can not a<>
hath hadd displesur for complaning I know not.
$12$ I know nother of the ymages nor of the letters.
$13$ mr baker sent woord (as I remember) that he merveled I tar<>
did not bring the book perfectly maid & sent no other <>
know.
